did.unittitle: Ferguson, J.S. Papers: Statement Covering Personal Experiences in Russia over a Period of Eighteen Months
did.abstract: J.S. Ferguson was an employee of the American Rolling Mill Company (ARMCO). The collection consists of Ferguson's "Statement" principally describing the Kuznetsk steel plan project.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: J.S. Ferguson was an employee of the American Rolling Mill Company (ARMCO), who, in July 1931 was granted a leave of absence to accept a commission from the Freyn Engineering Company as blast funace consultant at the Kuznetsk (integrated steel) plant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of Ferguson's "Statement" a 37 pp. bound typescript (dated April 30th), principally describing the Kuznetsk steel plan project, and which also contains an organizational and personnel chart, and a cover letter to an ARMCO official from October, 1930. The "Statement" contains a detailed technical, social and political analysis of the project, including relations between Communist and non-Communist engineers and other employees and officials, as well as its historical context. The Statement's subitle is "Soviet Russia and the Five Year Plan."
